intro: Tetrapterys stephaniana var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed tetrapterys, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, obovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
